result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorothy J. McIntosh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation review hearing scheduled in Br 6 on 12-17-2015 @ 10:00 am.

miscConds.notes: $100 due by 12-1-2015.  Balance to be paid within the first 2 years of probation.

The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  The Defendant is to continue with current counseling through ThedaCare Behavioral Health.  The Defendant is to undergo a psychiatric assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  The Defendant is to have no contact with any Kohls Dept Store or Walmart Store (if part of a mall, no parking within 50 yards of each store).  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  The Defendant cannot obtain any credit cards through retail stores without Agent approval.  The Defendant is to write an apology letter by 12-1-2015 to managers of both the Kohls & Walmart stores and provide a copy to the Court.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
